intro: Gyrostemon osmus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gyrostemon, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Gyrostemon osmus is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
